clinical_study.brief_title: Heart Rate Variability Analysis in Laparoscopic Surgery With or Without Transversus Abdominis Plane Block
clinical_study.official_title: Heart Rate Variability Analysis in Laparoscopic Surgery With or Without Transversus Abdominis Plane Block

brief_summary.textblock: Heart rate variability has been used widely in anesthetic practice nowadays. One of the most dominant applications is the nociception-analgesia balance. Some evidence support that heart rate variability correlates with perioperative stimulation and postoperative pain score. However, the heterogeneity between the studies and interference factors has limited their usage in clinical practice. On the other hand, peripheral nerve block is broadly used as a routine technique with general anesthesia, but few studies discuss the effect on heart rate variability. Our study focuses on the different HRV patterns of incision and insufflation during laparoscopic surgery with general anesthesia. Furthermore, we measure the effect of transversus abdominis plane nerve block to heart rate variability during surgery. By this comparison, we can discuss the influences of somatic stimulation, visceral stimulation, and pneumoperitoneum to heart rate variability, and then improve the accuracy of HRV-based nociception-analgesia monitors.

primary_outcome.measure: Different heart rate variability pattern during laparoscopy
primary_outcome.description: Different heart rate variability pattern in incision and inflation with or without TAP block

intervention.description: transversus abdominis plane block before or after laparoscopy operation

study_pop.textblock: scheduled to undergo general anesthesia for laparoscopic surgery (cholecystectomy or appendectomy) at Taitung MacKay memorial hospital
